17:00.race_name: Try Unibet's Supportboosts Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Should be more competitive handicapping at three
runners.name: Euphonia
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on debut at Haydock (6f); big backwards step when soundly beaten at 8-13 over C&D then failed to beat a rival when stepped up to 7f at Wolverhampton; should be more competitive handicapping at three.

runners.comment: Last-time-out second in C&D nursery has worked out well; widest draw the only negative
runners.name: Espona Bay
runners.spotlight: Gelded before finding just a filly who won her next couple of starts too strong in C&D nursery 11 weeks ago (the only other horse to come out of that race has won); up 1lb; widest draw the only negative.

runners.comment: Showed speed but weakened into eighth on stable/AW debut; today might not be his day
runners.name: Stock Market
runners.spotlight: Coolmore/Aidan O'Brien castoff (changed hands for 9,000gns last October); showed speed but weakened into eighth on stable/AW debut over this trip at Lingfield 23 days ago; might be one for a bit further down the line.

runners.comment: Will need to be alert early if she's to overcome a bad draw back sprinting
runners.name: Stay Sharp
runners.spotlight: Took good step forward when landing Yarmouth nursery in October (made all) and gave it a good shot from the front at Southwell next time (also 7f); didn't appear to stay 1m latest; will need to be alert early if she's to overcome a bad draw back sprinting.

runners.comment: Back from 71 days off when fifth at Wolverhampton last week; could strip fitter here
runners.name: Reality Queen
runners.spotlight: Form of nursery debut win at Bath in September has some substance and heavy ground might have been her undoing next time; back from 71 days off when fifth at Wolverhampton last week and she could strip fitter here.

runners.comment: There could be stronger finishers over this longer trip of 6f; no headgear on stable debut
runners.name: Filly Foden
runners.spotlight: Regular bridesmaid but there may be stronger finishers over this longer trip of 6f; starts out for Rod Millman (formerly trained by Alice Haynes) without headgear.

runners.comment: Pressed on a bit too soon latest; opening mark looks workable
runners.name: Ya Habibti
runners.spotlight: Improver, from very low base, in novice/maiden company and latest effort can be marked up as she was allowed to press on a bit soon; opening mark looks workable.

runners.comment: This half-brother to dual Group 1 winner Shaquille is worth persevering with
runners.name: Copperfield
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to dual Group 1 winner Shaquille, and has some of his quirks; plenty went wrong on handicap debut, following gelding operation/break, at Newcastle last time (SP 9-2); there's a good chance he'll settle better off a more honest pace wearing different headgear this evening; Julie Camacho is 12-61 (+37.58) here.

runners.comment: Beat just one home so far and switches to handicaps with plenty to prove
runners.name: Musical Soldier
runners.spotlight: Beat just one home so far and switches to handicaps with plenty to prove; hood retained; 7lb claimer takes the ride.

runners.comment: Finished behind Stock Market, and seven others, when sent off 18-1 for nursery debut
runners.name: Real Gold
runners.spotlight: Could do with breaking better and finished behind Stock Market, and seven others, when sent off 18-1 for nursery debut at Lingfield last month; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: 0-10 and seemed to hang fire when briefly hitting the front at Wolverhampton last time
runners.name: Madman
runners.spotlight: 0-10 and seemed to hang fire when briefly hitting the front at Wolverhampton last time; a surprise winner; tongue-tie and visor the headgear of choice.

runners.comment: Yet to get within 3l of winning; needs headgear (cheekpieces) to transform
runners.name: Grand Echo
runners.spotlight: Yet to get within 3l of winning and finished well behind Madman at Leicester last time; needs headgear (cheekpieces) to transform.

17:30.race_name: Unibet/EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Fair debut last week; turned out quickly and more is surely needed
runners.name: Je Suis Celebre
runners.spotlight: Blew the start but managed fourth of seven (beaten less than 5l) on debut at Wolverhampton last week (7f; 66-1); this is a quick turnaround and more is surely needed.

runners.comment: Pleasing fourth on Salisbury debut last May but nowhere near as good at Lingfield recently
runners.name: Soviet Symphony
runners.spotlight: Pleasing fourth on Salisbury debut last May but nowhere near as good when filling the same position at Lingfield 16 days ago (also 6f); others appeal more.

runners.comment: Costly defeat on debut at Lingfield put to bed when beating Okiru by 3l at Wolverhampton
runners.name: Free Your Spirit
runners.owner: R Rexton M Gander & M Osborne
runners.spotlight: Costly defeat on debut at Lingfield put to bed when beating Okiru by 3l at Wolverhampton just five days later; burdened with a 7lb penalty but Donagh Murphy takes off that amount; serious player.

runners.comment: Needs good step forward from debut effort four weeks ago to feature
runners.name: Blue Moon Warrior
runners.spotlight: They finished strung out behind the 1-16 winner when fourth of five on debut over 1m here four weeks ago (sent off 28-1); needs good step forward to feature.

runners.comment: Sent off 22-1 and failed to beat a rival on debut over C&D three weeks ago
runners.name: Nicolai
runners.owner: Hot To Trot Racing 1 & Andrew Bengough
runners.spotlight: Sent off 22-1 and failed to beat a rival on debut over C&D three weeks ago; surely needs more time.

runners.comment: Readily brushed aside by Free Your Spirit last time; could still place
runners.name: Okiru
runners.spotlight: Improver in finishing position and RPR terms but was ultimately no match for Free Your Spirit at Wolverhampton 16 days ago; hard to see him exacting his revenge but is a player for the places.

runners.comment: Perhaps paid the price for trying to serve it up to the 1-16 favourite when last on debut
runners.name: Our Guy
runners.spotlight: Perhaps paid the price for trying to serve it up to the 1-16 favourite when failing to beat a rival on debut here four weeks ago (1m; 16-1; finished a place behind Blue Moon Warrior); looks one for another day.

runners.comment: Surely didn't give her running on stable debut; 7f is worth revisiting; headgear change
runners.name: Adalida
runners.spotlight: Twice managed second for David Evans; never looked comfortable on debut for Stuart Williams off 134-day break at Wolverhampton in November (sent off 5-4 favourite); this longer trip is worth revisiting; tongue-tie quickly discarded, cheekpieces go on.

runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival on debut; didn't look the easiest once pressure was applied latest
runners.name: Sands End
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival on debut at Lingfield in November and didn't look the easiest once pressure was applied at Wolverhampton last week (finished sixth of eight; also 7f).

runners.comment: Major claims on C&D run four weeks ago and returning blinkers could help
runners.name: Lerwick
runners.spotlight: Back up to this more suitable trip here four weeks ago and showed more, going down by just over a length; major claims, particularly if returning blinkers have a positive effect (two of his top three RPRs came in them).

runners.comment: Good third following break/wind surgery in November but a bitterly disappointing fav since
runners.name: Triggerman
runners.spotlight: Good third following break/wind surgery in November but was a bitterly disappointing favourite when returned to the course and distance of his sole win last time; Polytrack debut but Julie Camacho has a good record here; visor chosen headgear.

runners.comment: Out of form when last seen and his most recent runs off a break make him opposable
runners.name: Billy Mill
runners.spotlight: Fully effective here but was out of form when last seen and his most recent runs off a break make him opposable.

runners.comment: Caught the eye of the stewards when sent off 33-1 for handicap debut over C&D latest
runners.name: Rorys Royale
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye of the stewards when sent off 33-1 for handicap debut over C&D four weeks ago (finished eight places behind Lerwick and one behind Capote's Dream); will want to break better but headgear (cheekpieces) could help focus him.

runners.comment: Again failed to pick up latest; hopes seemingly pinned on returning headgear
runners.name: Capotes Dream
runners.spotlight: Again failed to pick up when behind Lerwick over C&D four weeks ago (sent off 50-1); hopes seemingly pinned on returning headgear.

runners.comment: Weakened right out of it after being taken on for the lead at Wolverhampton on Tuesday
runners.name: Token Gesture
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap debut over C&D in September 2024; made the frame just once since and weakened right out of it after being taken on for the lead at Wolverhampton on Tuesday.

runners.comment: First handicap win may not be far away; trainer has AW team in good nick
runners.name: Maid In Chelsea
runners.spotlight: Dual novice winner for Jack Jones in 2024; handicapper is relenting and she ran okay at Lingfield two starts ago before seemingly stretched by 1m here; trainer has AW team in good nick.

runners.comment: Won either side of dismal effort; Tony Carroll runs three; Oisin Murphy just 1-22 for him
runners.name: Up The Anti
runners.spotlight: Doesn't look one for maximum faith given recent wins at Bath and here (SP 50-1) came either side of a dismal effort at Southwell; she's one of three runners for Tony Carroll; Oisin Murphy rides for the first time but he's just 1-22 for the yard.

runners.comment: Unlikely winner over this trip and with regular headgear still missing
runners.name: Danehill Star
runners.spotlight: Trainer runs three; all four career wins came between January and April last year; low-key return at Wolverhampton 11 days ago and regular headgear left off again here; failed to beat a rival the last time he ran over a trip this short.

runners.comment: Tony Carroll hasn't had him for long and he's due a change of luck; could arrive late
runners.name: Gundogan
runners.spotlight: Just 1-23 but Tony Carroll (who also runs Up The Anti and Danehill Star) hasn't had him for long and he's due a change of luck; could threaten if something takes them along at an honest clip.

18:30.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap

runners.comment: Back in handicap for first time since recording a PB when winning off this mark over C&D
runners.name: Mount Athos
runners.spotlight: Back in a handicap for the first time since recording a personal best when winning off this mark over C&D last March; that success took his track and trip record to 5-5; finished second then third to same rival in Listed company at Deauville recently; may not get his own way in front but is respected.

runners.comment: Definite form claims but this might be too muddling for him
runners.name: Witch Hunter
runners.spotlight: Ended losing run stretching back over two years at Newcastle in September and did best of the hold-up horses in similar contest to this last time; this might be too muddling for him.

runners.comment: Might want more of a test than he's likely to get on this drop back to 7f
runners.name: Popmaster
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye behind Mount Athos over C&D last March; hasn't done quite enough in two starts since returning from 176 days off to trigger a bet and he might want more of a test than he's likely to get on this drop back to 7f.

runners.comment: Won first AW starts then recorded peak figure in finishing second; progress has stalled
runners.name: Grand Traverse
runners.spotlight: Won first two AW starts then recorded peak figure in finishing second; progress has stalled of late, twice finishing behind Witch Hunter before managing only fifth of seven at Wolverhampton; others stronger; cheekpieces retained.

runners.comment: Fascinating contender if in-form yard can rekindle some of his old spark
runners.name: Doctor Khan Junior
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive to begin with, winning six of his first nine handicaps; trainer had a well-backed winner and a close second on New Year's Day; just not sure what he can do these days given he's made the track just twice in getting on for two years, and weakened into seventh both times; Polytrack debut.

runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P Hopper Mr & Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: His tactical speed should stand him in good stead back up to 7f this evening; dangerous
runners.name: Heathcliff
runners.spotlight: Top four RPRs achieved here, two notched up in November and December; his tactical speed should stand him in good stead back up to 7f this evening; dangerous.

runners.comment: Gelding operation could really help; market informative back at 7f
runners.name: The Lost King
runners.spotlight: Improver, in RPR terms, before pulling then hanging his chance away in the Britannia at Royal Ascot nearly seven months ago; subsequent gelding operation could really help; market informative back at 7f.

runners.comment: First runner for Oli Rix when failing to beat a rival at Lingfield five weeks ago
runners.name: Gallant
runners.spotlight: First runner for Oli Rix (joined him from Andrew Balding) when failing to beat a rival at Lingfield five weeks ago; can't consider; hood, introduced last time, removed; tongue-tie retained.

19:00.race_name: Try Unibet's Same Race Multi Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Back off the same mark as when gaining his sole success over C&D in August; holds claims
runners.name: Port Road
runners.spotlight: Ony beat one home at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) last month and needs to put that behind him, but is back off the same mark as when gaining his sole success over C&D in August; claims if producing his best.

runners.comment: Bids for a hat-trick off 7lb higher; beat a dual subsequent winner over C&D last time
runners.name: Foreseen
runners.spotlight: Racked up a losing run of 17, but now bids for a hat-trick after wins at Bath (1m, heavy) in October and over C&D last month; beat a dual subsequent winner last time and high on list despite 7lb rise.

runners.comment: Won C&D novice in Augsut 2022, but well held on last month's return/stable debut back here
runners.name: Caph Star
runners.spotlight: Won a novice over C&D for Roger Varian in August 2022, but not seen again until well held on stable/handicap debut back here five weeks ago (gelded in the meantime); probably best watched for now.

runners.comment: Well held here last time, but beaten a head or less in his first three goes over C&D
runners.name: Frostmagic
runners.spotlight: Usually ridden handily, but was held up when well held here seven weeks ago; had been beaten a head or less in his first three goes over C&D so capable of playing a part if reverting to a prominent ride.

runners.comment: Record over C&D reads 411621228; needs to bounce back from that latest effort
runners.name: Top Of The Class
runners.spotlight: Record over C&D reads 411621228 so has to be considered under these conditions, but she does need to bounce back from that latest effort seven weeks ago and remains 4lb above her last winning mark; stable also runs Study Up.

runners.comment: Lightly raced; well held on last month's stable debut; longer trip a doubt on breeding.
runners.name: Study Up
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since making a successful debut for Clive Cox in July 2024 and was returning from another lengthy absence when well held on stable debut at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) last month; longer trip not a positive on breeding.

runners.comment: Returning from a break when chasing home a subsequent winner at Chelmsford last month
runners.name: Rajinoora
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the fifth attempt at Epsom (7f, good to soft) last summer and was returning from 133 days off when second of nine at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) last month; that form has been franked so much respected despite 2lb rise.

runners.comment: Now at the veteran stage and enough to prove back from four months off
runners.name: Mostawaa
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who won off 13lb higher over C&D at the end of 2020, but rarely seen on the AW since; now at the veteran stage and enough to prove back from four months off.

runners.comment: Well held on stable debut at Wolverhampton last month; others preferred
runners.name: I Am Me
runners.spotlight: 7lb lower than when making a successful reappearance for Ed Bethell at Musselburgh (1m1f, good) last April, but patchy form since and well held on stable debut at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) last month; others preferred.

runners.breeder: Arrow Farm & Stud/Miss A Gibson Fleming
runners.comment: 1lb lower than when winning over C&D just under a year ago; watch market on stable debut
runners.name: Beauty Generation
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in seven starts in Ireland for Jessica Harrington, but is 1lb lower than when winning over C&D just under a year ago on his final outing for Marco Botti; changed hands for 1,000gns in November and worth a market check on debut for another new yard after three months off.

19:30.race_name: Unibet 3 Uniboosts A Day Handicap (London Stayers' Series Qualifier) (GBBPlus Race)

runners.breeder: C&s B/S Ltd C Younghusband K McGivern
runners.comment: Win number seven of 2025 last time, beating Bashful Boy by 3l; 5lb penalty but 5lb claim
runners.name: Sax Appeal
runners.spotlight: Well ridden when recording win number seven of 2025 last time, beating Bashful Boy by 3l; 5lb penalty offset by Warren Fentiman's 5lb claim; major claims of following up.

runners.comment: Didn't see out 2m on AW debut here four weeks ago; looks vulnerable again
runners.name: Macari
runners.owner: R Vaughan R Bisiker M Jones And S West
runners.spotlight: Struck over hurdles and won three on the Flat last year, most recently by a short head at Newbury in October; didn't see out 2m on AW debut here four weeks ago (finished behind Bashful Boy) and he could be taken on for the lead, or at least kept honest, by Sax Appeal this time.

runners.comment: Gone backwards for this yard, dropping right away on last month's return/AW debut
runners.name: Vice President
runners.owner: One More Moment Of Madness & Partners
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner at third attempt for Aidan O'Brien in 2024; gone backwards for this yard, dropping right away on last month's return at Lingfield (AW debut); much safer elsewhere; cheekpieces (worn when winning) return.

runners.comment: Likely needs to build on last month's stable debut/return to win
runners.name: Cruden
runners.spotlight: Dual winner for Jessica Harrington (one Flat/one Jumps) and ran well without scoring over hurdles for James Ewart; pleasing stable debut (purchased for £32,000)/returned to the Flat off 233-day break at Wolverhampton last month, no match for a Charlie Johnston-runner in the same owner group at Sax Appeal (1m6f; sent off 33-1); likely needs to build on that to win.

runners.comment: Made the track just twice in 2025, and finished well beaten both times
runners.name: Torcello
runners.spotlight: Hard to know what this 12yo is now capable of given he made the track just twice in 2025, and finished well beaten both times; goes without headgear for the first time since 2022.

runners.comment: Finished well behind Sax Appeal in September (C&D); twice ran okay at Wolverhampton since
runners.name: Barenboim
runners.spotlight: Finished well behind Sax Appeal over C&D in September but has run okay at Wolverhampton twice since; needs extra; cheekpieces, introduced last time, retained.

runners.breeder: Lynn Lodge Stud & Pier House Stud
runners.comment: Seemingly undone by sharper track when passing up a good opportunity on Tuesday
runners.name: Bashful Boy
runners.spotlight: Third over C&D then best of the rest behind Sax Appeal at Southwell; passed up what looked a good opportunity at Wolverhampton on Tuesday, perhaps undone by the sharper track.

20:00.race_name: Industry Leading In-Play Markets At Unibet Handicap

runners.comment: Back from another monster absence and market can guide on yard/Polytrack debut
runners.name: Definite
runners.spotlight: Reportedly made a noise when pulling up in first chase last time (sole start for Harriet Dickin); back from another monster absence and market can guide on yard/Polytrack debut; goes without headgear.

runners.comment: Winner off 2lb lower here last April (1m4f) but poor at Chelmsford (he's won there) since
runners.name: Egoiste
runners.spotlight: Winner off 2lb lower here last April (1m4f) but, given he's won at Chelmsford, much more could have been achieved there since.

runners.comment: This intermediate trip promises to suit and headgear (cheekpieces) could give him a lift
runners.name: Troy Story
runners.spotlight: Probably did too much too soon at Southwell last time, particularly as he was tackling 1m4f for the first time; this intermediate trip promises to suit and headgear (cheekpieces) could give him a lift.

runners.comment: Solid option given last two course runs (won then beaten a head by Prescott runner)
runners.name: Fiddlers Green
runners.owner: Phil Hart And The Cross Racing Club
runners.spotlight: Solid option given he won over C&D last July and went down by a head to a Prescott runner on his first visit since three weeks ago (1m4f); nudged up 3lb.

runners.comment: Could have done with a stronger gallop when managing third at Lingfield three weeks ago
runners.name: Voix De Bocelli
runners.spotlight: Both career wins came over 1m2f at Brighton last spring; could have done with a stronger gallop when managing third at Lingfield three weeks ago (1m4f); shortlisted.

runners.comment: Has a lower mark on AW, but that's seemingly for very good reason
runners.name: Phaedra
runners.spotlight: Triple winner at around this trip on turf last year; has a lower mark on AW, but that's seemingly for very good reason; finished eight places behind Fiddlers Green here three weeks ago.

runners.breeder: Qatar Bloodstock Ltd S A S U Ecurie De
runners.comment: Six-week break might have done him good/help him get back on track
runners.name: Age Of Time
runners.spotlight: Bitterly disappointing the last twice but had previously gone close over C&D before doubling his tally at Wolverhampton (9.4f); six-week break might have done him good.

runners.breeder: S A R L De Chambure Haras DEtreham
runners.comment: Mick Appleby/The Horse Watchers couldn't get him to win; possibly best watched
runners.name: Sonnerie Power
runners.spotlight: Mick Appleby and The Horse Watchers couldn't get him to win, but he ran plenty of nice races; changed hands for 6,000gns during time off; possibly best watched.

runners.comment: Can only be watched on handicap/AW debut
runners.name: Hopjes
runners.spotlight: Showed only minor promise in bumpers/on the Flat then didn't take to hurdling; can only be watched on handicap/AW debut; cheekpieces go on.

runners.comment: Regressed in AW novices but returning to further and switching to handicaps should help
runners.name: Saahir
runners.spotlight: Regressed in AW novices but returning to further and switching to handicaps should help.

runners.comment: First crack at middle distances when fourth at Lingfield 16 days ago (1m2f); player
runners.name: Sands Of Havana
runners.spotlight: First crack at middle distances when fourth at Lingfield 16 days ago (1m2f); this looks a good next step; player.

runners.comment: Low-key stable debut over this trip at Southwell; needs good step forward to feature
runners.name: Flynn Ryder
runners.spotlight: Ex Irish, changing hands for 5,500gns last October; low-key stable debut over this trip at Southwell 20 days ago (SP 28-1); needs good step forward to feature.

runners.comment: Handicap runs 139 days apart leave a lot to be desired; trip concern
runners.name: Read All About It
runners.spotlight: Handicap runs 139 days apart leave a lot to be desired and she has major questions to answer going beyond an extended 1m for the first time.

runners.comment: Triple winner here last year; claims if seeing out this new trip
runners.name: Take The Boat
runners.spotlight: Triple winner for Des Donovan here last year (1m/7f); second run for this yard/back from a break when hitting the line quite strongly over 9.4f at Wolverhampton on Friday; claims if seeing out this new trip.

12:35.race_name: Midnite Aint Your Grandads Bookie Handicap

runners.comment: Sound effort when third of five over C&D one month ago; unexposed and far from ruled out
runners.name: Potters Marmite
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on the Flat but she posted a sound effort when third of five over C&D one month ago; unexposed and she could have a better effort in her; far from ruled out.

runners.comment: Lively in the market lately, winning last month but beaten 10l on Saturday; same mark
runners.name: Arc Zoosve
runners.spotlight: Having just his third start for this yard when rewarding market support in first-time cheekpieces at Wolverhampton last month; 7-2 from 11-2 but not in the same form when beaten 10l at Southwell (also about 2m, Tapeta) on Saturday, though; interesting to see if his backers return again.

runners.comment: 3lb nudge for Wolverhampton win a fortnight ago looks fair; player again
runners.name: Tuba
runners.spotlight: Market springer when fourth in December and he made the breakthrough when first of nine (also Wolverhampton, about 2m, Tapeta) a fortnight later; 3lb nudge doesn't look insurmountable and he likely has more to offer for a yard he only joined in October; considered.

runners.comment: Signs of a revival three weeks ago; visor goes on and he's not discounted
runners.name: The Craftymaster
runners.owner: R Miles V Miles T Stamp & Partner
runners.spotlight: Rampant around this time last year, his win at Wolverhampton (about 2m, Tapeta) in December kicking off a six-timer that included two C&D wins in February; also scored at Newcastle in March but 0-19 subsequently; the handicapper is relenting, however, and there were signs of a revival when fourth of 12 at Wolverhampton three weeks ago; tongue-tie and blinkers are swapped for a visor; not dismissed.

runners.comment: Won C&D handicap in May and he's back down to that mark; better effort no surprise
runners.name: Queensland Boy
runners.spotlight: Landed a fourth win when comfortably picking up C&D handicap in May; 0-7 since but he's back down to that winning mark and a better effort would be no surprise.

runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford in November but moderate run last time; cheekpieces given a go
runners.name: Taranjerine
runners.spotlight: Had been gelded before popping up at 22-1 at Chelmsford (13.5f, Polytrack) in November; solid third here (1m5f; Gearing's Point fourth) next time but he bombed out at Southwell (1m6f, Tapeta; Forglen fourth) 19 days ago; needs to bounce back in newly applied cheekpieces.

runners.breeder: G Hedley & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: 1m4f winner here in 2023; untested at this trip but placed over hurdles and could go well
runners.name: Gearings Point
runners.spotlight: Course winner here (1m4f) in 2023, one of four wins that year; has drawn a blank subsequently but it was a step in the right direction when 33-1 and fourth of nine over 1m5f (Taranjerine third) at this track last month; untested at this trip on the Flat but has been placed over hurdles and could go well.

runners.comment: In-form mare; off the mark in November before a third (also C&D) last month; player
runners.name: Sapphire Sirocco
runners.spotlight: In-form mare who got off the mark here in November before finishing third of eight (also C&D) last month; player despite widest stall.

runners.comment: Solid efforts in three of four starts since September; probably on the premises again
runners.name: Forglen
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton in July; solid efforts in three of four starts since September, including when fourth of 12 at Southwell (also 1m6f, Tapeta) last month; probably on the premises again.

runners.comment: Narrow win at Southwell in October wasn't built on last time; question mark after that
runners.name: Fornido
runners.spotlight: Made the breakthrough when narrowly prevailing in 1m6f Southwell handicap (Tapeta; 28-1) in October but not so good on Chelmsford's Polytrack the following month; still relatively unexposed but has a question to answer after that.

runners.comment: 0-9 on AW; fair effort at Wolverhampton a fortnight ago but others hold greater appeal
runners.name: Hiconic
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner over hurdles but 0-9 on AW; fair effort when fourth of nine at Wolverhampton (about 2m, Tapeta) a fortnight ago but others hold greater appeal.

runners.comment: Unseated at the first on hurdling debut last month and previous Flat form fails to inspire
runners.name: Coisty
runners.spotlight: Unseated at the first flight on his hurdling debut last month and previous Flat form fails to inspire; up in trip.

runners.comment: Course winner (7f) in 2023; returned from a break with solid third (C&D) three weeks ago
runners.name: Tiger Crusade
runners.spotlight: Course winner (7f) in 2023; took advantage of a drop in class to win 7f handicap at Brighton in June and it was a good effort on his only subsequent appearance when third over C&D three weeks ago; same mark and he should be in the shake up.

runners.comment: On a losing run but can go well after a break and this is his easiest task for many a moon
runners.name: Silky Wilkie
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxxxi & E Burke
runners.spotlight: 0-7 here but he's been runner-up four times; losing run dates back to April 2023 but he has slipped to a dangerous mark and was far from disgraced in the Ayr Silver Cup on his penultimate start; can go well after a break and this represents his easiest task for many a moon.

runners.comment: Made all for two wins in Ireland (6f, good); beaten 18l on Tapeta/stable debut last time
runners.name: No Return
runners.spotlight: Made all for his two wins in Ireland (6f, good) and ran respectably on the last of his four goes on Dundalk's Polytrack; market drifter when 20-1 and beaten 18l on his Tapeta/stable debut last time, however, having raced freely; interesting to see how he goes in the betting this time.

runners.comment: Has struggled in handicaps and was picked up for £1,600 in December; stable debut
runners.name: Elouises Prince
runners.spotlight: Maiden and novice winner at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) for Robert Cowell last year but has struggled in handicaps, including on Polytrack and in two starts for Adrian McGuinness; picked up for £1,600 after the last of those and has a fair bit to prove starting out for another new yard.

runners.comment: Won over 6f (Tapeta) last month; solid 2nd under a penalty 8 days ago; leading contender
runners.name: Accrual
runners.spotlight: Free-going sort who showed 6f was no problem when making all at Wolverhampton (Tapeta) last month; solid second under a penalty over that C&D eight days ago and gets to run off 2lb lower this time; leading contender on this Polytrack debut.

runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & Tally Ho Stud
runners.comment: Sixth win when taking Polytrack handicap (6f) off 3lb lower last time; player once again
runners.name: Hierarchy
runners.spotlight: C&D "winner" around a year ago (disqualified for weighing in light) who was back on the scoresheet at Southwell (Tapeta) in July; made it win number six when taking a Kempton handicap (also 6f, Polytrack) off 3lb lower last time and he's a player once again.

runners.comment: Sole success came when narrowly winning 3-runner novice in 2024; not the percentage call
runners.name: Cayman Tai
runners.spotlight: 1-15, the win coming when he scrambled home at 2-5 in a three-runner Ffos Las novice (5f, good to soft) in 2024; patchy form since but last time's third at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) in November was a fair effort; doesn't look the percentage call, though.

runners.comment: Continues to run well and was beaten a neck off this mark on Friday; impossible to ignore
runners.name: Charlie Mason
runners.spotlight: Better than ever in the second half of 2025, winning at Doncaster (good) in September and running well in five handicaps since, including when beaten a neck at Chelmsford (also 6f, Polytrack) on Friday; same mark and he's impossible to ignore once again.

13:35.race_name: Create Your Bet Builders At Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: Heavy defeats last three starts (all 1m); blinkers and sprinting given a go on this return
runners.name: Fitzmaurice
runners.spotlight: Suffered heavy defeats on his last three starts (all 1m), the latter two occasions for this yard; blinkers and sprinting are given a whirl on this return from a break.

runners.comment: Fourth course win when scoring in October; not disgraced in better race latest; player
runners.name: Harry Brown
runners.owner: Peter Crate And Gallagher Bloodstock Ltd
runners.spotlight: Four of his five wins have come here (all 6f), including an October success three starts ago; has also scored at 5f and can be excused his latest effort, when racing out of his grade; respected.

runners.comment: 0-14 but it was a sound second over C&D off this mark a fortnight ago; solid claims
runners.name: Rajeteriat
runners.spotlight: 0-14 but it was a sound effort when second over C&D (winner's won again since) off this mark a fortnight ago; solid claims off the back of that.

runners.comment: 3rd C&D win 3 weeks ago; not at her best on Sunday but no surprise if she bounces back
runners.name: Gogo Yubari
runners.spotlight: Secured a third C&D win when scoring by a neck three weeks ago; wasn't at her best when eighth of 12 at Southwell (5f, Tapeta) off this mark on Sunday but no surprise if she swiftly bounces back.

runners.comment: Neck 2nd to Gogo Yubari over C&D 3 weeks ago; contender reunited with Callum Shepherd
runners.name: Its Showtime
runners.spotlight: Sole success came over C&D in May 2024; regularly misses the break and did so again before flying home under Callum Shepherd to finish a neck behind Gogo Yubari over C&D three weeks ago; hasn't matched that in two starts since but Shepherd is on board for just the second time and she's a contender.

runners.comment: 3-time C&D winner; down to a career-low mark & has gone well after a break; not discounted
runners.name: The Defiant
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner who last tasted success when bagging a 5f Wolverhampton handicap off 10lb higher in March; out of form in the summer but he's dropped to a career-low mark and has gone well after a break; not discounted.

14:05.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 10,000gns yearling; gelded 5yo who is likely best watched on this belated debut
runners.name: Harry Dont Bite
runners.spotlight: 10,000gns yearling by Calyx; ninth foal; half-brother to German/French 7f-1m2f winner Zavaro (including Group 3; RPR 107); gelded 5yo who is likely best watched on this belated debut.

runners.comment: 26,000euros yearling; dam dual bumper winner; probably one for further down the line
runners.name: Freda
runners.spotlight: 26,000euros yearling by Decorated Knight; second foal; half-sister to Listed-placed 7f winner Asian Daze (including 2yo; RPR 109); dam dual bumper winner; probably one for further down the line.

runners.comment: Bought for 5,000gns in October; back down in trip for stable debut; not far away on RPRs
runners.name: Nuptown Girl
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress for Charles Hills and was last seen finishing fifth of sixth in a 1m4f handicap here in September; sold for 5,000gns in October; dropped back down in trip for this stable debut and isn't far away on RPRs.

runners.comment: Better on second start when sixth (8.5f, Tapeta) one month ago; needs to kick on again
runners.name: Roman Quest
runners.spotlight: 33-1 but he took a firm step forward from a modest debut when sixth of 12 at Wolverhampton (8.5f, Tapeta) one month ago; needs to kick on again but that's not out of the question.

runners.comment: 2nd last 3 starts; big player back in a maiden; declared 1:45 Wolverhampton yesterday.
runners.name: Sovereign Wealth
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on his last three starts, all 7f AW nurseries including here; leading contender back in maiden company; declared 1:45 Wolverhampton yesterday.

runners.comment: Encouraging debut then second (also Southwell, 7f, Tapeta) last time; considered
runners.name: Space Invasion
runners.spotlight: Market springer (100-30 from 12-1) when an encouraging sixth of 14 on his debut and bettered that when second (also Southwell, 7f, Tapeta) last time; small query stepped up to this trip but otherwise considered.

runners.comment: By Flag Of Honour; half-sister to 7f 2yo winner D Day (RPR 83); best watched on this debut
runners.name: Crimson Dawn
runners.owner: Ben Pay And Carter Roofing Solutions Ltd
runners.spotlight: By Flag Of Honour; sixth foal; half-sister to 7f 2yo winner D Day (RPR 83); dam placed 6f 2yo (70); best watched on this debut.

runners.comment: Much improved when 2nd in Southwell novice (1m, Tapeta) six weeks ago; sets the standard
runners.name: Lisa Joy
runners.spotlight: Finished last on her debut but much more like it when chasing home a stablemate in Southwell novice (1m, Tapeta) six weeks ago; sets the standard on that run with the promise of better to come.

runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival in two starts so far and modest handicaps beckon
runners.name: Peas And Queues
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival in two starts so far and modest handicaps beckon.

runners.comment: 33-1 and blew the start when beating one home (6f, Polytrack) in September; tongue-tie on
runners.name: Uthooba
runners.spotlight: 33-1 and she blew the start when beating one home at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) in September; pedigree suggests she ought to be capable of better; tongue-tie goes on.

runners.comment: Fairly encouraging debut fourth (7f, Polytrack) last month; potential improver up in trip
runners.name: Vizija
runners.spotlight: Drifted in the market prior to a fairly encouraging fourth of 11 at Kempton (7f, Polytrack; 20-1) last month; potential improver and this step up in trip should suit on pedigree.

14:35.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: Good second on penultimate start wasn't backed up next time; may bounce back
runners.name: Athenian Spirit
runners.owner: Mpr Xxi S Marris & Rathmoy Racing Vii
runners.spotlight: Good effort on penultimate start when second of 12 at Wolverhampton (first-time cheekpieces) in October but didn't back that up at Newcastle (also 7f, Tapeta) the following month; contender if bouncing back.

runners.comment: Best of 3 qualifying runs was her last; now goes up in trip for h'cap debut; interesting
runners.name: Frankali
runners.spotlight: Getting the hang of things in three qualifying runs, culminating with a sixth of ten at Kempton (6f, Polytrack; first-time hood) last month, when shaping as though this extra furlong will help; no hood today but still looks interesting on her handicap debut.

runners.comment: Extended mile stretched him in November and 6f was too sharp latest; 7f may be his trip
runners.name: Kanes A Lott
runners.owner: David N Reynolds & C D Watkins
runners.spotlight: Found Wolverhampton's extended mile a stretch on his handicap debut in November and couldn't get in a blow over 6f at Chelmsford (Polytrack) last time; possible this trip will be his sweet spot.

runners.comment: Modest maiden; has been gelded and gets a new headgear combination for his AW debut
runners.name: Giles Glory
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden who was tried in cheekpieces when a below-par fourth of eight in 7f Leicester nursery (soft) in October; subsequently gelded and more is needed with a tongue-tie and visor given a go; AW debut.

runners.comment: Only 7th of 10 on nursery debut here (6f); work to do back up to this trip
runners.name: Electrocution
runners.spotlight: Hints of promise on his final qualifying run when sixth at Kempton in November but didn't build on that when seventh of ten in a course nursery (also 6f, Polytrack) three weeks ago; work to do back up to this trip.

runners.comment: Won 7f Polytrack nursery in September; not matched that since but still needs considering
runners.name: Miss Ayala
runners.spotlight: The most experienced of these and the only winner in the field too, that success coming in a Chelmsford nursery (7f, Polytrack) in September; didn't match that in two subsequent starts but still warrants consideration.

runners.comment: Best run on penultimate start and solid effort latest; should go well again
runners.name: Forceful Lady
runners.spotlight: Best run when second of nine at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) in November and she was turning in a solid effort until hampered late at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack) last time; should go well again.

runners.comment: Not much to shout about so far but may do better now handicapping; watch the market
runners.name: East India Breeze
runners.spotlight: Not much to shout about in his qualifying runs but took four starts to get a mark and may do better now handicapping; watch the market.

runners.comment: Just 9-2 for nursery debut (8.5f) but could only finish sixth of nine; still early days
runners.name: Blue Mountains
runners.spotlight: Went off 9-2 for her nursery debut but no immediate improvement when sixth of nine at Wolverhampton (8.5f, Tapeta) three weeks ago; still early days but needs more dropping back down in trip.

15:05.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Got up in the final strides over C&D four days ago, opening her account; key player
runners.name: Naval Ensign
runners.spotlight: Finished strongly and got up in the final strides over C&D four days ago, opening her account at the 13th attempt; incurs 5lb penalty for only a neck win but is one of the main players.

runners.comment: Lost his form in a light 2025 campaign, failing to beat a rival last time
runners.name: Walking On Clouds
runners.spotlight: Runner-up several times over 7f but all wins at shorter; lost his form in a light 2025 campaign, failing to beat a rival on stable debut most recently; others preferred.

runners.comment: Maiden; better off with Naval Ensign on C&D running four days ago; fighting chance
runners.name: Sanditon
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; close third in a couple of C&D events since wearing headgear, latest behind Naval Ensign four days ago; gets a 5lb pull with that rival; fighting chance.

runners.comment: Dead-heated off current mark last May but not in the same form since
runners.name: Nubough
runners.spotlight: Veteran; dead-heated off current mark at Chelmsford last May but not in the same form in just three runs since; failed to beat a rival on two of those occasions.

runners.comment: Record is 0-20 but she's proving consistent; made the frame over C&D four days ago
runners.name: Blue Empress
runners.spotlight: Record is 0-20 but she's proving consistent, having made the frame in five of last six outings, latest when fourth over C&D four days ago; solid chance, despite the maiden status.

runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.comment: Has weak claims on bare form but may improve for this step back up in trip
runners.name: Henry Tudor
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has weak claims on bare form, mostly over sprint distances; however, gives the impression this return to 7f may prompt improvement; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Has largely dismal form
runners.name: Lasswade
runners.spotlight: Has largely dismal form and is held by a couple of these rivals on C&D running four days ago.

runners.comment: Won in November and close third in C&D handicap one week ago; solid
runners.name: Woodhay Whisper
runners.spotlight: Doubled her tally when winning at Wolverhampton (6f, Polytrack) in November and has continued to run well since, including when close third in C&D handicap one week ago; solid.

runners.comment: Won twice in July (turf) but went off the boil after; not easy to predict on this return
runners.name: Twirler
runners.spotlight: Scored at Windsor (good) in July and went in again under a penalty at Epsom (also 6f, good to soft) five days later; went off the boil subsequently and difficult to know what's likely on this first start for 117 days.

runners.comment: Got on a roll last year and it was a good comeback third last month; big player
runners.name: Combustion
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who won his first four starts last year (including C&D) and returned from a 248-day break with close third at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) one month ago; big player.

runners.comment: Big run over C&D in a better race than this last month; good claims on that effort
runners.name: The Organiser
runners.spotlight: Soft-ground 6f Brighton winner in September who got back on track with a good fourth over C&D one month ago; that was a better race than this and puts him firmly in the picture.

runners.comment: Races freely and yet to get going for this yard; addition of blinkers not enough to tempt
runners.name: La Fleur Petrus
runners.owner: Chris Wright & The Grand Crus Lovers
runners.spotlight: 7f Southwell maiden winner (first-time hood) for Charlie Hills but yet to get going in four starts for this yard; has been racing freely so interesting to see what she'll make of blinkers joining her tongue-tie.

runners.comment: 0-12 and only mild promise in two starts for this yard; can find his level at some point
runners.name: Fort Augustus
runners.spotlight: 0-12 and only mild promise in two starts for this yard; dropping down the weights, however, and will likely find his level at some point.

runners.comment: Dual Brighton winner who ran well when 2nd over C&D 3 weeks ago; on the premises again
runners.name: Alshimali
runners.spotlight: Dual Brighton winner last year who ran well when second over C&D three weeks ago; should be on the premises again.

runners.comment: 5th AW win when scoring (6f, Polytrack) in October; feasibly treated if ready after break
runners.name: Southbank
runners.spotlight: Landed a fifth AW win when scoring at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) in October; respectable effort under a penalty over that C&D one week later; remains feasibly treated if ready to go after two months away.
